intro: Galium commutatum, commonly known as bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Galium commutatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in traditional herbal medicine.
